posts.post_content:
@Lord\_of\_Omnipotence: Indeed.  
  
With the child molester art, and people complaining about vampires in popular culture, and people complaining about his second ability which is just as inconsequential as [Lionheart Maverick](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lionheart Maverick)'s second ability, and the unfavorable comparisons to [Vampiure Nocturnus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampiure Nocturnus), this is one of the cards where its Gatherer rating does not do it justice. It's not even so overpowered in a way that deserves hate like [Jace, the Mind Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Jace, the Mind Sculptor) or [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel).

Posted By: MyrBattlecube (8/12/2011 10:46:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
OK, first on the art.... It's actually good. Yes it looks creepy and not as glorious as the other vampires, but that's the point.... He's a vampire that steals your creatures or child.... He suppose to look disturbed.  
  
Now onto his second ability... You guys do realize it does not require him to tap to activate, right? And he can tap himself on the turn he's cast! And you can activate this as a response? In a weenie vampire deck, this is killer, even in Standard 2011, unless you're against RDW, you should have no problem pumping out 4 to 5 vampires by t4 before him, then you can start capturing on turn four. You should also include 4 [Bloodghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodghast) for increased consistence for creature recursion, and also 8 sac. lands like [Marsh Flats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Marsh Flats) and [Verdant Catacombs](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Verdant Catacombs).  
  
t1: 1 drop  
t2: 2 1 drops  
t3: Pump more weenies for numbers, or Gatekeeper, or Nighthawk  
t4: Pump another 1 drop if you can for redundancy, then cast Captivating Vampire, t... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: jfre81 (7/23/2011 9:14:26 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Why is this card rated anything less than 4/5?   
Oh, yeah, because everyone decided that they hated it once they looked at the art and neglected to actually read the text.   
  
Why is this worse than Nocturnus?  
-Really bad art  
-Less of a buff  
-No flying buff  
-Less Power/Toughness  
  
Why is this better than Nocturnus?  
-It doesn't cost $15 a pop  
-Cheaper cmc  
-It doesn't NEED to be in a vamp deck  
-It doesn't NEED to be in a mono-black deck (not that you would run vamps in anything other than)  
-The +1 buff is ALWAYS on even in a mono-black (Swamps?)  
  
You will almost never get his second ability to fire, but that shouldn't actually detract from the card. Would I run four of these before Nocturnus? Of course not. Would that stop me from running four of this if I didn't have Nocturnus? Also, of course not.
posts.html:

Why is this better than Nocturnus?

You will almost never get his second ability to fire, but that shouldn't actually detract from the card. Would I run four of these before Nocturnus? Of course not. Would that stop me from running four of this if I didn't have Nocturnus? Also, of course not.
